Reviews.Title: “almost USD30 daily for the internet”
Reviews.Author: numberoneson
Reviews.Content: this is plain robbery for a budget hotel. internet is not a luxury or option anymore, it is a requirement just like hot water and A/C. this is outright price gouging. too bad because otherwise this is a quite decent airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst holiday inn express ever”
Reviews.Author: sabrina g
Reviews.Content: I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone. This was by far the WORST experience at a hotel I have EVER seen. First, the front desk attendant had horrible customer service & she was not accommodating at all. My reservation clearly says for 2 people, 2 beds. It took her forever to check us in and get me a room. Next issue, the room is a hole in the wall with 2 beds, like they are herding cows. There are ZERO amenities in this room. No soap, lotion, enough towels!! THey only had 1 towel for the 2 of us. And to top it off, we tried to take a shower and the water DID NOT GET HOT! I am sorry but before I go on a 16 hour flight, i'd like to take a hot shower and I could not even do this. I had dinner there at their buffet & the food was uneatable with flies roaming around the food everywhere. Absolutely disgusting and horrible experience. Also, they do not have wake up calls. AND I tried calling the front desk multiple times to ask for more towels & some amenities but NOONE ANSWERED! SO I couldn't even complain and I wasn't about to go down to the front desk to get these things when I was inappropriately dressed. Horrible service from A to Z and I have no idea what my money even paid for here.

Reviews.Title: “In the wilderness of Dubai...a pure transit pit stop!”
Reviews.Author: Aneesh2011
Reviews.Content: Instead of hanging around in the vast Dubai Terminal, The Holiday Inn Express Dubai Airport is a good pit stop. Its close to the airport - though taxis are very scarce there and the only way to get there is the hotel shuttle. Services - like Internet, Breakfast etc are either expensive or very average. The staff can be very unfriendly and unwelcoming at times!

Reviews.Title: “Will do the job for a overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Chris T
Reviews.Content: Bed is comfortable and the room is clean. It is 3 mins by taxi from the airport. It is value of money. Negatives: Internet is expensive, breakfast at the restaurant is very ordinary and sometimes there is quite a long wait at the front desk to check in. If your flights arrives quite early into dubai, there is an extra charge for early check-in (we were told normal check-in time was 3pm) and the charge was almost 70% the cost of another night stay (from memory). Shuttle bus only comes once an hour so the only option is taxi if you missed the bus as it is impossible to walk across the freeway that cuts in between the hotel and the airport

Reviews.Title: “Average - Great if on a budget”
Reviews.Author: ffdawood
Reviews.Content: An average hotel. Great if on a budget, it's neat and clean and offers only the bare minimum. The complimentary breakfast is a nice touch, and there is a free shuttle to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Has potential, but they meet the fine things”
Reviews.Author: HotelSpy55
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located across the two big Dubai International Airport terminals 1 and 3. The hotel serves the purpose for a night or two, but they miss the fine things. Firstly, the towels and bathmats for the bathroom in the room are generally torn and ripped. Housekeeping or the management do not pay attention to these necessities. The carpets in the rooms I've stayed in over the past 4 months are stained, so, again, the hotel management is not paying attention to properly having the carpets shampooed. On my last trip, housekeeping left one set of towels and not two. Maybe they're cutting back or housekeeping wasn't do their job? The breakfast is cheap, meaning, the buffet offerings are not only on the cheap side, but it looks as if it's been set up as an after-thought. One day, the eggs are soft-boiled, with three pots of the same choices of croissants. The next day, there are no eggs. Poorly prepared sausages or Turkey Bacon or on display in the heated-looking but not warm serving pots. The rest of the buffet is not replenished. Finally, no attendants are actively cleaning the tables, hence, it's usually a hunt to find a clean table. Overall if you're needing a hotel that's convenient to the terminals with a free shuttle only to terminals 1 and 3 (you have to take a cab to terminal 2), then this is fine. But, don't expect the same quality you get at other InterContinental Group hotels like the Crowne Plaza, Holiday Inn or Holiday Inn Express.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel if you're staying near the airport and don't want to go too far into town”
Reviews.Author: moaksey
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for a couple of days. I was in Dubai for business, visiting a trade show at the Airport Expo which is a 5 minute ride from this hotel. The price was way higher than expected but that's Dubai! When booking it seemed to have everything I'd need so I went ahead. When I arrived at DXB I did check to see if there was a free shuttle bus around. There was one waiting for another Holiday Inn but the driver said my hotel's one only came once an hour. Oh well. I got a very short taxi ride to the hotel at 3am. Check in was good but took longer than expected. Whenever you communicate with any of the reception staff they look at you, listen then stare at their computer screen for 5 minutes before acknowledging you - apart from the ladies on day shift who were lovely. Anyway, reception took a while as they said they were fully booked and it'd take a while. This surprised me at 3am but it is an airport hotel so I wasn't angry. The hotel faces the airport terminal which would have been amazing for me. I, however, ended up with a room at the back of the property which was just as good. I asked for an iron as soon as I arrived and one came within minutes. The room itself was clean, comfortable and well equipped. There were no bottles of complimentary mineral water which you tend to get at all hotels in DXB which was surprising. They did sell it in the lobby for 10 Dhs a pop. I had internet included in my room rate (although I had to question this when I checked in as I expect most rates don't include it). There is wifi in the lobby but only wired connections in the rooms. Basic internet was fine but I didn't get my work VPN to work for more than 30 seconds which made being online pretty useless as I was there for business. The breakfast was basic but plentiful, with a decent selection. It's definitely a step above other Holiday Inn Express properties I've stayed at. The bar was nice and relaxing. The restaurant in the evening was good. I was put off at first as I didn't want the buffet, but they said they had a small a la carte menu which I could choose from. This was very small but the food was good (I had curry). There is a hotel taxi service so you can pretty much always get one when you leave. Although the cars are nice, big SUVs, they do have standard meters so are just as cheap as others. The drivers are all good - friendly too. Most of the guests are obviously in transit so it did feel a bit like an airport terminal at times but again, it's an airport hotel so what else can you expect? The gym was good - large and with enough equipment to keep you busy. Great views of the airport too. Check out was alright. I had to question an internet charge which took a while. I was then confused by four 1.67 Dhs charges which said they were allocated to phone calls - of which I made none. The receptionist explained to me that it wasn't for calls - it was for the hotel's accounts and was a rounding up of one of the room taxes. I am still not convinced and think it's a bit dodgy (although the total adds up to less than $2). So, for a short stay this place is great - especially if you've done Dubai before and want to avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an overnight.”
Reviews.Author: aerowise
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely adequate for 1 or 2 nights if waiting on a flight. Rooms are nice and they have a full bar/lounge to get a drink and some food. It is right across the street from Terminal 2 at DXB. They have a shuttle to the airport which runs every hour on the hour. It is hard to find the shuttle from the airport to the hotel. Get a cab, the airport ones, and it should cost you about $8 USD. Anything more and it is a rip off look for the airport taxi's. I would not recommend this place if on holiday as it is not really near anything. Overall, clean and adequate.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: MDtravelinglady
Reviews.Content: Im rating it as poor because a clean bathroom is everything to me!!! I definitely got what I paid for and being cheap was all it was good for, well that and it's extremely close to the airport. The bathroom floor in the room was so disgusting and had hair and dirty marks on it that I wouldn't even take off my socks to go to the toilet. Considering the cleanliness of the bathroom I didn't even take my clothes off to crawl in bed. I only stayed a few hours before my next flight thankfully but can tell you that cheap isn't always better and definitely won't be staying here next time I visit Dubai. The food in the bar, not that great...bit on the pricey side for a burger/fries and 3 drinks was $150 or close to it. I think its $25 a night for internet service.

Reviews.Title: “affordable, convenient and well kept”
Reviews.Author: Brian K
Reviews.Content: Everything in Dubai is pretty expensive. That being said, I think this hotel is a good value, all things considered. The staff is always nice and helpful. The restaurant is polished and modern. The complimentary breakfast buffet is above average for a free breakfast. I usually just use it when I have an overnight stay in the region and it's become my go to place for a night to relax between flights. It's right by the airport so it doesn't get much more convenient (unless you stay in the hotel that is IN the airport). One tip though: the shuttle from the airport to the hotel is infrequent. I think it only comes once an hour. Just take a cab to the hotel. It's worth the 35 AED.

Reviews.Title: “Stained bathroom,holes in bed cover, dirty mirrors”
Reviews.Author: apple_green_10
Reviews.Content: Honestly saying for a hotel in Dubai, this one is the worst. The free shuttle never came to pick me up, I waited for two hours after I had gotten off of a 8 hour flight. I wanted to come and sleep for a bit before I boarded my 16 hour flight. I ended up taking a taxi to the hotel and when I arrived my room was supposedly ready. The room was wretched. First of all it wasn't a king size bed as I had requested, there was a hole on the purple cover of the bed and dirty on the cover. The shower head had a rusty color draining down from it. The mirrors were dirty and there was mold in the room. When I complained to the duty manager they didn't do anything. I didn't even sleep that night. I understand that its not a luxury hotel, but it still was $200. Also, there was no shampoo, bath towels, or soap in the room and when I asked for a wake up call, they said that service was not offered.

Reviews.Title: “Transit through Dubai”
Reviews.Author: kkdas48
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located very close to airport making it very easy to reach particularly in odd hour.Overall experience during stay is good.Rooms are good and clean.Breakfast is excellent. Good place for a short stay. Courtsy transport to and from hotel is not reliable.Front desk can be more helpful and informative in resolving issues.

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Billed Twice”
Reviews.Author: SteveYea
Reviews.Content: In general the hotel was comfortable and clean and the staff welcoming and friendly. The fact that the airport bus only leaves hourly meant a wait at the airport which frankly for an airport hotel is not an acceptable level of service. My credit card was billed twice and I am still trying to get a refund after two phone calls and two emails, so far. I also checked out before breakfast started and ordered a breakfast box ( a facility they offer) when checking in, this did not appear and little was done about it. I suppose you get what you pay for and had these two incidents not ocurred I would have been happy enough despite the poor airport bus service.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying there again!!”
Reviews.Author: SoniaG4
Reviews.Content: There was nothing wrong with the accommodation - bearing in mind you get what you pay for, although it could have been cleaner. My problem was being told at 01:30 "your room will be ready in 30 minutes" I don't think so!! You book the room from 14:00 the previous day so why isn't it ready!! I asked to pay in AED and was charged in £'s. We were told by the restaurant staff our reservation didn't include evening meal - oh yes it did!! Check in and check out took longer than in other hotels. Will be using the Premier Inn which is next door in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient after a long flight!”
Reviews.Author: JoeRFreitas
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one and a half day, on my way to Bangalore, India. It sure is the best option after a long flight (and most of them to Dubai are) for it stays some 5 minutes from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice price and a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: swedishtravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after arriving with a flight late in the evening. We took the free bus from the airport, it was really tricky to find, the car park and bus area was full of cars and buses and they did not have clear bus stops, they stopped here and there. It was a bit stressful to find the bus. There were also several buses from Holiday Inn, you must get the one belonging to the airport extress hotel. When arriving to the hotel check in was quick and the room was nice and clean, the beds were good and we had a good nights sleep. As we arrived to the hotel at around 1 am we were tired and we were a bit dissapointed actually to hear that the breakfast was only served until 9.30. We woke up early and went to breakfast around 9 am and it was full chaos, no free tables, food was running out and there was no coffee. And at 9.30 they shut the lights off, wanting people to leave. The breakfast experience was not so nice. But overall, concidering the good price for staying there, the hotel is okey.

Reviews.Title: “average service”
Reviews.Author: Timothy Y
Reviews.Content: The service provided is average. The food is average. Room key needs to be changed after room service. The taxis in front of the hotel always over charge passengers. The facilities in the conference room are average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Friendly Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Kashefs S
Reviews.Content: Nice location and easy access to the airport - Free Shuttle Provided every hour to the airport - Neat and Clean rooms - Cooperative staff members - I would like to specially mention here that the services I received from their duty manager, Yasir Rafique was excellent. He was very understanding and cooperative in resolving and providing solutions to all my concerned issues - Lastly, its walking distance from Dubai Metro and you can comfortably go anywhere you want including all terminals of Dubai airport.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: PolarBear777
Reviews.Content: Room type provided was not as booked. Breakfast buffet (included) was good. However, the major issue was that the shuttle bus was infrequent, only hourly, which is terrible for an airport hotel. Washroom appeared to be dirty upon check-in. Overall, should have been much better, and I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stop-over!”
Reviews.Author: MoniquiMc
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through the Emirates website. We caught the free shuttle bus service from the airport upon arrival in Dubai and then again back to the airport when we were leaving. You can see the airport from just out the front door of the Holiday Inn, but we did not hear any planes. We were very happy with our room. It was clean, comfortable, quiet and spacious, just what we wanted after a long flight. The people on reception were helpful when we asked where the closet metro station was, which was a 5 minute walk from this Holiday Inn. We were most impressed with the buffet breakfast which came complimentary. We wish we stayed more than just 1 night! We would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal when having a late arrival.”
Reviews.Author: Sander J
Reviews.Content: Since my flight arrived around 12 pm, I have booked the first night at the Holiday Inn Express. Since the airport is quite big, you do need a car or a taxi to get you the hotel. Because of the airport surcharge the taxi-fare cost me 25 Dirhams. The check- in went smooth, and my room was very comfortable. You could even choose between soft or firm pillows. WiFi wasn't complimentary, but since I only spend the night here I didn't really bother. Dubai Airport offers free WiFi, so you can read your mail whilst waiting at the Border Control. The complimentary breakfast was very good. There was a good range of food (both hot and cold) and coffee/thee. Although the hotel is very close to the airport, there is no outside noise in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveller604
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival there was no record of my 4 day reservation - fortunately I had the confirmation sheet. It took over 30 minutes for them to get the registration straightened out and the information entered into their system properly. The next day they informed me that I was checking out when my room key didn't work -- once again showed them the confirmation sheet. They again took a considerable amount of time to get this straightened out. In addition, the hot food in the breakfast buffet was never replenished so if you came after 6 a.m. chances are there was no meat, eggs, or other hot food -- just sweet rolls, cold cereal, (both of which I can't eat due to allergies), and fruit. Food was also of poor quality and variety.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: briebw
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel every time I travel thru Dubai. It is very clean. Rooms and bathrooms are spacious and clean. The dinner buffet is nice. There is a good workout room available. The beds are comfortable enough for a short stay. Continental breakfast is not good thou, would not recommend eating breakfast here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but average for the cost paid”
Reviews.Author: Svenara
Reviews.Content: I was a solo traveler for this trip. Being a single women, the advantages of this hotel were that it was close to the airport and the train stop. You could reach the city conveniently via the train. The breakfast was good and had a selection of multiple cuisines. I enjoyed by stay here. However having stayed across multiple cities all over the world, I felt that this place was average compared to the money I spent.

Reviews.Title: “Better second time around, but still issues”
Reviews.Author: Dharma_Punk
Reviews.Content: You can read my earlier review which hasn't really changed much. I stayed again in Nov 2011. Good deal for the price, nice new rooms, nice bed, pillows, TV, etc. Quiet, and a good sleep. Of course, it only takes one bad experience to ruin the visit: I had bought a new CamelBak backpack earlier in the day before checking in, and as I was unpacking, I took it out and brought it to the sink in the bathroom to fill with water. I placed it in the sink and filled it up, then when I pulled it out, I saw white stuff all over it! The cleaning staff didn't clean my sink, and it was covered with old toothpaste from the previous occupant. I didn't think to look in the sink before putting the backpack in it first, as it was supposed to be clean! The sink was disgusting, and I don't know how the cleaning staff missed it. Of course, my brand new $120 backpack was now smeared with someone else's used toothpaste and spit, making me not very happy. And after the experiences I had the last time I stayed, I have decided not to return. I spent the next hour scrubbing my new backpack and trying not to be grossed out. I called the desk and told them about it, they sent some kid up to wipe the sink out, without a word or apology. But what are you going to do? The other issue is with the mafia chauffer people outside, which are outside every Holiday Inn in Dubai. I complained about it last time, but the management hasn't changed anything. Basically, they keep a town-car outside for guests, which is fine. Some people may want a pricey, chauffeured car to get around. If they advertised it as such, it would be fine. But when you walk outside, they they come up to you "Taxi, sir? Taxi? You need taxi?" They try to pass it off as a taxi, which it obviously isn't. A trip to Festival City Mall costs about $5 in a real taxi, these jerks charge you about $15. Reading through the reviews, I've seen many people tricked by this. I yelled at the guy, saying yes, I DO want a taxi, and will wave one down, and he started talking smack abou the real taxis, saying they are dangerous, expensive, can't be trusted, many accidents, etc. Why do they feel the need to trick the customer? Why not just call it a "private car", which is what it is? Anyway, don't fall for it. Real taxis are safe, clean and cheap and pass by all the time. I never waited more than 1 minute for one. What makes me really mad is that the hotel staff won't call one for you, only direct you to the chauffeur outside. I'm sure the hotel runs it, which is why they haven't changed their policy since the last time I stayed. Otherwise, it's a clean, safe hotel, a little expensive, but ok. Breakfast was ok, but the coffee is instant and was horrible. What, brewed coffee is too much to ask? I at the dinner buffet one night, and it was twice the cost of what could have got at a mall restaurant, and the beer was $10. At least they didn't give me an occupied room again like last time.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle bus service is a joke”
Reviews.Author: natalie g
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel mainly because of its proximity to the airport and the free shuttle bus that apparently runs every 15 minutes. The shuttle bus service turned out to be highly infrequent. I waited 1 hour 10 to get to the hotel upon arrival in Dubai, and the service that I was counting on to take me to the airport after checking out was cancelled. I ended up having to jump in a cab (which cost about £10) and race to the airport, but thanks to Holiday Inn I missed the check in for my flight (it closed early due to some airspace restrictions that day), and I had to spend the night in the airport. Another point that riled me was that they chose to charge my card when I checked in (rather than when I booked), and use their poor exchange rate, which meant that the room cost me about £10 more that the price shown when I booked. The room itself was fine, although you don't get any complimentary toiletries, the hair and body wash had not been filled up and there were only 2 English speaking channels on the TV. Also, there was a notice advising that during my stay the water would turned off for 4 hours from midnight, which I think is highly acceptable - there was no mention of this by the staff. For what they charge I think the rooms are very overpriced considering that most people will incur extra expenses in having to get cabs to and from the airport - the cabs are notorious for ripping off customers. Also, wi-fi is very pricey and the staff on reception are quite sullen and unhelpful, especially about the shuttle bus service and directions on how to get around. The only real plus was the free ATM machine on site.

Reviews.Title: ““Great hotel. Would recommend.””
Reviews.Author: Aperdana
Reviews.Content: i have just returned from a week in Dubai. I stayed in the Holiday Inn Express Dubai Airport. This hotel was excellent. The rooms were clean and well equipped. Staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was really good with lots to choose from this is a great budget hotel to stay, The shower is great, nice bed and pillows to choose. Breakfast included in room booking which is great and serve fresh fruits and sausages scrambled eggs, I would be happy to stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone visiting Dubai. Special thanks to Yasir Duty Manager.

Reviews.Title: “Good "layover" hotel”
Reviews.Author: D M
Reviews.Content: I used to use the hotel voucher's that Emirates Airlines handed out (under strict guidelines though), and stayed at one of their provided hotels - usually the Millennium Hotel. I found it a big hassle to wait for the Emirates shuttle to those hotels, especially in the middle of the night. While searching for a close hotel online, I found the Holiday Inn Express Dubai Airport. A very quick taxi ride at a nominal cost was a refreshing change from the shuttle. The hotel appears to be new. The rooms are clean and well-stocked with the amenities one would need for a transfer (iron, bath amenities, a great powerful shower, etc). The service is focused on efficiency as it appears they know most guests are checking in as transfer quests. A great hotel that is close to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “OK but WIFI is EXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: Kevin J
Reviews.Content: The hotel is generally clean and quiet. But the internet service is pretty poor and costs 85 Dirham ($23) per day. Give me a break! There are better hotels at lower prices with the same amenities (airport shuttle) and FREE WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be better.”
Reviews.Author: Xango82
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times on my way in and out of Dubai for business and it used to be a whole lot better than it is today. The staff are helpful upon check in but after that they seem to be too busy to help. The rooms are average size for a hotel. The bathroom is not that bad, I actually like the showers. The lounge is not that bad for drinks but the food is not too good, and its overpriced. There used to be prostitutes crawling around everywhere in the lounge but I don’t think they are allowed in there anymore. It is convenient for those who have a few hour layover and want to freshen up before their next flight but the hotel in the terminal is a much better choice and not too much more expensive. It is close to the Metro so that is good for those who like to take public transportation to save a few bucks. The Metro is actually not bad, I use it all the time. The hotel is overpriced for the quality of the stay. I no longer stay at this hotel because the prices have gone up so much and the service and quality have not changed. I would recommend this hotel to people who don’t mind paying a lot for a few days at a Holiday Inn Express. For those who DO care about what they get for their money, don’t stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What you pay is what you get”
Reviews.Author: cyr1ne
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Express is a limited service 2 star hotel, and we pay low rate, yet we get a clean room with breakfast. For those are expecting 5 star service pay in thousands then complain. please people get a life. Moreover why would you complain on complimentary shuttle bus the hotel provides or breakfast? you dont like it dont use it. I will

Reviews.Title: “Worth It”
Reviews.Author: jd82
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple nights and its a Holiday Inn so you pretty much know what to expect. I thought it was a very good hotel, room was spacious and clean and right across from terminal 2 which was ideal. The staff were friendly and a taxi from here to any attraction in dubai shouldnt cost you more than 15-20 dollars (u.s.). The price was avergage and you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Pierre55
Reviews.Content: A very bad experience in this hotel. Asked for a high floor level room on our reservation formula : they gave us a second floor room facing a wall. Old TV out of order. About 10 people in the line in the morning to check out with one employee at the front desk. The complimentary shuttle was to pick us up at 6 am(we were more than 10 people waiting including pilots).At 6;30 the shuttle was still not there with no one caring at the front desk. We had to rush to find a taxi and nearly missed our plane. We encountered a VERY ,VERY POOR SERVICE.

Reviews.Title: “Far Superior Hotel nearby”
Reviews.Author: Alan M
Reviews.Content: This truly awful hotel says on it's in room card that it's aim is to ensure competitive value for money then goes onto list the services it does not provide! So lets compare with it's nearest competitor next door: 1: Complimentary Drinking Water (NO!) (Absolutely unheard of in Dubai and the Gulf) 2. Wake Up call (NO!) 3. Room Service (NO!) 4. Swimming pool (NO!) 5. Complimentary Internet access(NO!) BTW Paid for WIFI internet access then could not get a signal) 6. Flat screen TV (NO! some old box unit with tiny screen) 7. Reliable 30 minute shuttle to airport? (NO! Hourly and unreliable) 8. Nice bar / restaurant.. Lets just say the bar is an adult zone. 9. Cheap Rates (NO!) 522 Dirhams is not cheap nor competitive for the above. As a priority club member I am appalled at just how poor value for money this place is. Not only will I never stay here again but would advise any other traveller to avoid it like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, room and breakfast for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: ancsi50
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel on wotif for $55/night (inc breakfast!) for overnight stay between flights. The hotel is very close to the airport but there is a freeway inbetween so you can't walk there. We didn't notify the hotel in advance so waited and waited for the 'scheduled' minibus for an hour but it did not turn up. When we realised that the bus wont come despite the attendant's often repeated assurances that 'the bus will be here in the next 15 minutes'. Ended up taking a cab simply by refusing to get out the car after we told the driver the address and he protested that its too close! $4 and 5 minutes later we were at the hotel reception. The hotel is nice and modern, the receptionist was very polite and helpful and we were in our airconditioned room in 10 minutes after arrival. Same-day bus tours of Dubai and various other bus tours can also be booked in the hotel lobby. Our room was clean, quiet and modern, the bed comfortable, the bathroom clean and equipped with toiletries. There was a jug for ice that we could get from a dedicated room on the floor. The restaurant for breakfast opened at 6:00 am. The selection of food and drinks were very good - teas, coffee, hot chocolate, various juices, bottled water, a variety of fresh fruits, jams, breads, olives, cucumber, tomato, fetta, croissants and danish pastries. We had a lovely overnight stay and continued our way and arrived to Europe refreshed the following day. It is excellent value for money; we will stay there again on the way to Europe to avoid arriving jetlagged - its well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to airport”
Reviews.Author: assaman
Reviews.Content: I have been for one night in April 2010. It is a nice hotel, located in front of Terminal 3, opposite the Airport Road. The hotel shuttle takes to the airport. The hotel is very nice, and the room is without noise. It is just for one or two night stay, not more, since the location is not the best. Good option for transit passengers. Internet is expensive. Breakfast was good. Room was good size and very clean, with furniture of good quality. All new. Employees are very courteous and polite. The hotel would need some "green" aspects, with some plants or trees into the building, because it has an artificial look.

Reviews.Title: “Close to DXB”
Reviews.Author: RobGeorgia
Reviews.Content: Read lots of issues about the Hotel shuttle. If landing in terminal 1 as you exit the terminal you will see the rental car kiosks. Right next to Hertz is the hotel kiosk (see picture) ask them how to get to the shuttle and times. I have also included a picture of where you can find the metro (photo 4) this is across from the hotel and is call the Emirates station, very easy and safe and clean. Hotel is about 5 to 8 mins from the airport. Hotel it quite, the business center is super basic. The breakfast although free is marginal at best. No wifi in rooms (cable) but they do have wifi in the lobby (not free). This is a good hotel for a one night layover. Front desk seemed pretty busy all the time.Take the metro to Deira City Center (drops you at the mall and less that a 10 minute ride on the Metro) for shopping and eating. Also can take the metro to the Dubai and Emirates malls but have a longer travel time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Gurmeet_Singh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights here and almost everything was fine. Rooms are of average size but clean. Internet is on paid basis and a bit expensive. Breakfast is a cold continental buffet. It seems out of place but you will get taxis easily. On one day, fire alarm went on early in the morning and it was quite annoying. No word of apology from the management. I'll look for another hotel next time but can stay here again if I have no option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stop-Over”
Reviews.Author: Gregser76
Reviews.Content: Arrived late in Dubai en-route back to UK from Malaysia. Booked twin room for very good price and was surprised at the size and quality of the room. I was expecting to be crammed in with other travellers but that was not the case. Went into the bar which was open until 2am. Noticed a few ladies of the night and was surprised to find this in a Holiday Inn near to the airport. The girls were polite and propositioned you with no pressure and a smile. I politely declined. Overall it is worth reviewing this hotel as you really do get a great deal when you arrive and the shower, beds and breakfast are of a high quality. I would have liked to have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you are doing an overnighter in Dubai.”
Reviews.Author: AussieOseas
Reviews.Content: Any review depends on what you want and expect. The Holiday Inn Express Dubai Airport provided us with everything we wanted and expected from an overnight stop in Dubai.Emirates, perhaps the best airline, virtually enforces an overnight stay on passengers travelling between the UK and Australia. Anyway, a free shuttle bus met us at Dubai airport after a 5-10 minute wait and took us to the Holiday Inn Express where the reception staff we quick to process our reservation and set us on our way to the room which was at least satisfactory and gave us a comfortable night before breakfast which was included in the price, and the shuttle whisked us off to the airport on time as it does hourly. Top service! Perfect for us and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “2 minutes taxi from the airport”
Reviews.Author: JadeandSimon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as a stopover. Was looking for something cheap, clean, nice bed, hot shower and breakfast. Delivered on all fronts. Not too much spare space in the room - so great for one night but wouldn't stay here if visiting Dubai. We had our luggage checked through to our final destination, so we only had our small backpacks with a change and a toothbrush. (However if you fly Emirates, they give you a travel pack with a fairly decent toothbrush and toothpaste in it, so if I'd known I would have packed our toothbrushes in our checked baggage.) Our room was twin 'double' beds, but really they are just a little bit bigger than singles. I don't think they were full doubles. Beds were quite firm - similar to Singapore or Malaysia or Japan. Internet was at an additional cost, and not great reception in the rooms - is more designed for use in the lobby. Snacks, toiletries can all be purchased in the lobby - nothing is complimentary. Location was great - two minutes taxi from the airport, and cheap. We taxied from the airport to the Mall of the Emirates, and then caught the train back to the airport, then got a taxi from the airport to the hotel again. Mall of the Emirates is definately worth a look. Breakfast was fairly standard, but good. Would definately stay here again on a stopover to break up a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service!”
Reviews.Author: elainep08
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as we had a long transit time in Dubai and were travelling with an 18 month old baby. When we arrived at the airport we saw a man holding a Holiday Inn Express sign. We approached him only to be abruptly told the shuttle bus was outside. We had to ask where it stopped, waited 40 mins for it to arrive and then were rudely told it would not depart for another 20 minutes! So we had to get a taxi. When we arrived at the hotel the reservations clerk was not very friendly and took ages to check us in. Can't fault the rooms for the price but when we got on the shuttle bus back to the airport at 6am the next morning EVERYONE on the bus was complaining about the shuttle service and the staff. Would NOT stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced, clean, functional and though across from the airport very quiet”
Reviews.Author: Safariafficionado
Reviews.Content: The 381 room Holiday In Express, just 'across' the highway from the main terminal of Dubai International Airport can be reached within minutes by the complimentary shuttle bus. Another advantage is the vicinity of the Metro, which makes going places easy and is quite cheap compared to constantly using taxis, especially when doing a bit of 'elevated' sightseeing - great views in fact as the trains rush along over the traffic. Check in was swift, I got a non smoking room as prerequested and a queen sized bed. Two sets of pillows were available, harder and softer, so no one need to suffer of a neck ache when waking up after selecting one's individual preference. The room, though on the small side, had all I needed for my few days in Dubai - never touched the TV but immediately connected by 'wire' to the super fast internet where I got all the news I needed. Reception organised the delivery of some vanity kit on the double which was impressive too. An ironing board and flat iron is available from the hotel's housekeeping which proved valuable. Best in the bathroom was the water pressure under the shower, making the massage jet function of the showerhead work extremely well. Every time I passed the reception and had a question to ask, staff were courteous and got me what I wanted. Admittedly the HIX is not a luxury hotel but provides all one really needs at a fraction of the cost of a 5 star. Breakfast is complimentary, and the wireless internet connection in the restaurant works well, and window seats offer a view across to the airport where jets come and go every minute. Although I did not have dinner at the hotel, I checked out the evening buffet which at 59 DH is very good value for money too. Comes recommended when budget matters and being close to the airport, on departure the free hotel shuttle again delivers one back in no time to the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for stopovers”
Reviews.Author: Rover82
Reviews.Content: The HI Express is a no frills place; if you are stopping over in Dubai and want a cheap place, this would be good for you. I had a flight at 7 am, so instead of driving over Abu Dhabi at 4 am, i chose to come the night before and stay here, was worth it in every way. On the other hand, its not actually that close to the airport, so keep some time on hand to reach the airport from here and to reach the hotel from somewhere in Dubai as there are no signs/directions from the main road in front of it. The lobby itself is clean and there are hourly shuttles to the airport. The rooms are basic and OK, as you would expect from HI Expresses.

Reviews.Title: “First time staying in an airport hotel and it was just great.”
Reviews.Author: suec58
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and found that even though this was our first stay at an airport hotel there was no noise for us in either planes or other rooms moving around etc. The room was great and staff were very friendly. Breakfast was included and very reasonable and found the best deal was through going direct through the Holiday Inn website after doing a lot of searching. Although not a cooked breakfast there was plenty of choice with cereal, fruit, toast, pastries and cold meats and cheeses. Shuttle to the airport was easy and regular. A short walk (if you can stand the heat) to the metro which takes you more less to anywhere you need to get. All day ticket to all zones was only an extra UAD than to the 2 zones we used the previous day. 16 UAD per person all day ticket. Late checkout of 4pm was offered and no problem with leaving our luggage safely locked away before taking the shuttle to the airport late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Quick and easy stay-over for your next day flight”
Reviews.Author: MarkManama
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to catch my early flight the next morning. The gym was more spacious than expected, the room good, great price. I had a late bite in the bar (buffet in the restaurant was closing) which was ok, be aware of a few 'working ladies' though. Wifi is available, but only included in the room-rate for certain packages. Reception arranged a breakfast-pack for me in the morning as I was leaving early morning for the 5 min shuttle drive to the airport

Reviews.Title: “keep away.”
Reviews.Author: bibi d
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel in jan for 1 night as a stopover. the purpose was to get some rest and see abit of dubai for few hrs with the ease of getting to and from airport. at first emailed ahead to get early check in. got told would be ok if not busy and this never happened. shuttle was late picking up and then when we went for our check in ppl at desk were completely not trained in customer service. at first they took 20 mins to see to me because one person was at desk and others were watching her work. when i finally checked in they gave me a 2 ppl room when i was supposed to get a 3. i went back with my diabetic mother who by now was completely shattered and got told i must be mistaken about the room. this was before she finally decided to check sytem and i was right. then the computer system wen down so i was told to wait in lobby for 30mins with my mother sleeping on the sofas by now. got to my room and no blanket in room for 3rd person. we just gave up and went to sleep. this was my 4th visit to dubai and do not mistake this review for all holiday inns in dubai. i have stayed at jumeira one and the staff are wonderful their. this will be my last visit to holiday inn airport.

Reviews.Title: “No hassle, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: DrCCarter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night as part of an airport stopover. Prewvious reviews had worried me slightly about getting to the hotel from the airport and it's shuttle bus service. I e-mailed the hotel a few days prior to arriving to inform them of a late arrival and to ask about the shuttle service. I was promptly e-mailed back a shuttle timetable and detailed directions of where to catch it. I was even e-mailed a picture of the bus!. On arrival at the airport I followed the easy instructions, and caught the free shuttle no problem. It was a full bus, but checkin was quick and efficient. The room was clean and just what the Dr ordered for my short stop-over and a few hours sleep!. The following morning, again no issues, got back to the airport terminal no problem , after a basic but decent continental breakfast (included free) with the hotel. Will definitely use this place particularly because of its low price and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crouching_Hippo
Reviews.Content: I often wonder how people can have such a bad experience in hotels when all the other reviews say such good things about the place. I guess it must be down to the people themselves and their expectations, although I would be interested if the people who rant on so many reviews actually rant as forcefully as they do when they are actually at the hotel. Just an observation. Anyway, I had booked for two nights and I arrived in Dubai in the evening and phoned the hotel about the shuttle bus and was informed that it should arrive at 1945 as it was out of hours. And it did arrive at 1945. A short ride to the hotel and I checked in painlessly, whilst overcoming people who jumped the queue. I have found that in this part of the world and some other parts of Asia, this is the same; you just have to be a ‘bit alpha’ about standing your turn in the queue. Checking in was painless, the room was spotless (even for a smoking room) and the air-conditioning was very welcome as it was searingly hot outside. Great choice of TV channels, but I had a slight problem connecting to the internet, so I phoned reception and within two minutes, someone had come to the room and sorted it out. Very good service indeed. The trip to the bar was, erm, interesting as one other reviewer put it and I did people watch, but got a little annoyed when the people watching turned into being approached by the people I was watching. I only wanted a quiet beer before having some food. If you are female and you go into the bar, then I suspect you will not have a problem. The food in the restaurant was good. A buffet meal for AED 59 with a great range of food. I ended up taking a tray of food to my room which was infinitely better than sitting on my own in the restaurant. On the second night, the food was largely the same with a few changes to some of the dishes, however this isn’t really a problem as I expect guests don’t stay for too many nights with it being an airport hotel. The following day I had to take a journey out and was pointed in the direction of the hotel taxi, which I thought might be expensive, but was pleasantly surprised when the bill came in quite low and that was without a meter. I suspect the local taxis might have been cheaper, but for convenience, this was perfect. I enquired about the shuttle bus to take me back to the airport when I was leaving and the receptionist told me that it would leave on the hour. And it did. So no problems there. Again, I am not sure why one reviewer was so het up about the shuttle bus (mainly lack of information on the website I guess, but you can always pick up the phone). Oh and the breakfast was also fine, which is the standard continental fayre, however in the UK, they now do offer a hot option as well, so Dubai Airport franchise, you may want to pick this up. All in all, a great, convenient hotel at a great price. If you’re not bothered about having a drink, then you won’t baulk at the bar prices and in the reception there are snacks and water that you can purchase, so you don’t actually need to leave the hotel. If you want cheaper provisions, then grab a taxi to the nearest Emerat fuel station and you can pick it all up there. For the sake of a few Dirhams, I would rather get it from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: jg161
Reviews.Content: Stayed just 1 night while waiting for a very early morning flight from terminal 2. The hotel is quite close to the main DXB terminal, perhaps just less than 10 mins in a taxi (probably about 20 mins to terminal 2). I was unaware of the free shuttle, but given the relatively cheap price of taxi's I would not have bothered as I had AED cash anyways. Desk staff were friendly, but check-in was quite slow despite there not being many people - check out was quick and easy with no issues. Room was clean and bed was comfortable, perhaps a little small but for the price that's to be expected. Generally I avoid airport hotels as I often find they over charge. This was not the case here and would stay again as price was very good. The work area in the room was quite cramped and as such I moved to the bar to have more space to work and some WiFi as there is none in the room (and a beer of course). Whether or not you get in-room WiFi still seems to be hit and miss across hotels around the world but If you have the cash to put a 2nd phone in the toilet, then corridor located WIFi should not be a stretch! The hotel bar.... quite an experience to say the least, do drop in for a beer and a spot of people watching. Seems the room price is being subsidised by the rather expensive prices for a pint (and the internet!) but given the heat you just went through waiting for the shuttle or a taxi, you will pay whatever for a cold drink !

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel to stay near airport”
Reviews.Author: debdoot_2000
Reviews.Content: From rooms you can see flights departing and landing. It has free airport shuttle after every one hour. Restaurant is good. Metro station to travel all over Dubai is at a walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget option for Dubai Airport”
Reviews.Author: DohaShredder
Reviews.Content: It's cheap, clean and very close to the Airport,. They even have a free airport shuttle every hour. Although the rooms are not at all flashy (I mean you even have an old box style TV); there are clean, and the beds are comfy. Don't bother staying here if you're in Dubai for a few days. . .but if you've got an early flight, then this if certainly a good option.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience ever, don't rely on the shuttle, you'll die of heat stoke and dehydration first!”
Reviews.Author: DRMB
Reviews.Content: Both booking.com and this HI Express get a zero rating from because I tried and tried and tried to get information on the shuttle. There is a never ending loop on the booking.com to the HI webpage and back with the request to get in touch with the hotel to book the shuttle. I only wanted a few hours while in transit to get a shower and maybe a few hours’ sleep, but wasted fully 2 hours on arrival trying to find out where and when. In the end I gave up and got a taxi because the heat was unbearable. The taxi driver was really really pissed off and swore at me all the way in Hindi, which I can understand.You can't expect pax to wait for a long time in the heat and there is nowhere cool to avoid heat stroke. Why don’t they put the shuttle details on their web page? Then I would have bothered and wouldn’t have wasted my money. It is stupid for HI Ex to think that the information on the shuttle pick up can be given on arrival! On arrival, I was told the shuttle time table and it is not like the US where you can phone up, it is only hourly and such a poor service. I was also told on arrival there are no wake up calls, and the hotel staff were of a take it or leave it nature. I also found in the rooms that the liquid soap had crystals or mould growing in it, that there were black marks on the sheets, and that in the 40C heat (>105F) they provide a duvet on the bed suitable for -10C. How impossible! Very, very frustrating. To make it worse, early in the morning the cleaning staff talk and shout loudly to each other up and down the corridors and they bang and clash their cleaning trolleys. Even when I opened the door and asked for quiet they started shouting loudly to each other within a few minutes. As for breakfast, there is a fairly decent selection but the WORST coffee every, anywhere in the world. It is so bad! It looks like coffe but tastes like nothen, maybe dishwater. Even when I tried 3 shots of the expresso, it cam out like some awful black tasteless muck. Why bother with coffe if it is dreadful? This was the worst coffee I have had anywhere in the world! I do not recommend this hotel at all. It is better to fly with Emirates and get their hotel for free if you have a long transit time

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: aysha37
Reviews.Content: I would like to share my stay feedback at your hotel as it was a great deal for me on all levels,starting with the food that was delicious and very well presented to the cleanleaness of the hotel, in addition to the convenience of the location with it being so close to the airport. Overall it was really good value and I will surely come back. Many Thanks, Ayesha

Reviews.Title: “strictly ok”
Reviews.Author: rmehta27
Reviews.Content: just ok... nothing great at all and very slow with service and staff was not very courteous as well.... rooms are nice but size is small.... the restaurant is very average though with limited choice of break fast and hardly any choice of food availability .... the only good part of the location is just next to the airport terminal 3 in dubai

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: misflopes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just in front of the airport. However, you need to take the hotel shuttle or a cab. The shuttle is very random and unpredictable: I tried to get it twice and I had never succeeded. The location of the hotel is perfect for a stopover but not so pleasant or convenient for a stay on holidays, although there is a metro station at walking distance from the hotel. The room was excellent: spotless, modern furniture, the beds were extremely comfortable, the sheets very pleasant to touch and the bathroom was also very good and modern. The room had a large window facing a highway and the airport but no noise at all could be heard. The relation quality/price is excellent, difficult to beat. On the negative side, the breakfast was really poor and the coffee was disgusting. I was twice in this hotel. Regarding the first time, I have no complains concerning the service. However, on the second time, I arrived at the hotel at around 3 am and I was informed that the room was not ready and I had to wait. I was puzzled: how could the room be not ready if I had made a reservation of the room for the period that started the day before at 2 pm? I complained but I had to wait about 20 minutes and nobody could explain me how could that happen.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: DonnaKronmiller
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, the bed was comfortable as well. The internet worked and the food for dinner and breakfast was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: POTPOT_PUTUT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the airport and offers airport transfer which is very convenient and thrifty. Rooms are clean and complimentary breakfast is good. This hotel is good for people who wants convenience and hotel like experience with a very minimum pay. Great value for money! Take advantage of the free hotel-airport transfers if you want to save on taxi fares and want to use the Dubai Metro which has a station at the airport. Buffet lunch/ dinner is available at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelCamel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice and it is my only choicefor a stopover in Dubai. The major drawback is getting to the hotel in the first place. The first time the shuttle was late from its appointed complimentary pick-up from terminal three, but the second time it never arrived at all, so needed to grab a taxi. Getting back to the airport using the shuttle was not a problem. The hotel need to implement a half hourly shuttle service when they know that guests will be arriving by plane. Reception was efficient, but my Priority Club membership was no recognised, but no worry. The room was excellent, it is the sort of place I wish I could take with me everywhere I travel. Beautiful decor and one of the most comfortable beds on my travels, it had a solid choice of TV channels and a good bathroom. I only ate breakfast here and it was fairly average, not much variety. The hotel is isolated from the major sites of Dubai, but that is probably not the reason why you would stay here in the first place. If you do have some spare time, just head to the Emirates Metro station which is under a 10 minute walk, and from there most of the cities sites are within reach. Remember it is a Holiday Inn Express so it is not full of facilities or services such as room service, but for that trade-off (which I am happy to make) you get a modern room for an excellent price. The price is even better if you book well in advance directly on the hotel's website. Look forward to staying here again on my next transit through Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Walked into an occupied room! Not pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: Dharma_Punk
Reviews.Content: I booked in advance, and when I arrived at the airport, no taxi would take me to the hotel. They all said it was too close, and to wait for the shuttle. I hated this, as I was tired and it was hot in the parking garage, and I had to lug my bags over to the shuttle area (which IS NOT marked, by the way, so I had no idea where to go). I saw some shuttles from other hotels, so I walked over there and eventually a shuttle showed up. Anyway, I show up at the airport and even though it's 4am, there is a line and only two overworked employees at the front desk. Finally I get checked in and a female employee gives me room 288. I go up to the room and open the door to find...a guy lying in bed eating a sandwich. He freaks out, I freak out... I shut the door. By now I'm tired, hot and stinky and just want to collapse, but I have to go back to the front desk, wait in line again, and the girl just says sorry and tells me she gave me the wrong room number. I read some other reviews here and this isn't the first time they've done this, evidently. She tells me sorry, and I tell her she needs to apologize to the guy in 288, too. So finally I get to my room, nice enough, very clean and new, no smells. The room has a window but it looks into the inside of the building, as it's an empty square design. No big deal. No view outside anyway except the airport across the highway. First thing I want to do is take a shower, so I turn on the water and wait and wait.......finally I call the front desk (no answer) so I say enough already and go to bed. The next morning I head down to the breakfast, which was really nothing but toast, jams, cereal and absolutely the worst coffee I've ever had. It may sound petty, but the coffee was my biggest complaint about this place. It is instant and comes out of a machine, and it was the most vile, bitter, metallic tasting, non-drinkable stuff imaginable. I did eat the musli and croissants, however. Anyway, I went to the front desk to complain about no hot water in the room, as no one answers the phone, and she said she would send a worker up. He showed up in 15 minutes and what's his solution? He turns the sink and shower on full throttle for 10 minutes. He says they have a solar array on the roof that heats the water, but it takes a long time to reach certain rooms. I like how everywhere in the bathroom are signs asking the customer to conserve water, don't wash your towel everyday, etc, but then install a solar water heater that makes the user waste 25 gallons of water before even getting in the shower. The place is new, the shower stall was nice, except it wasn't put together properly and the door didn't close all the way, meaning the water splashed out into the floor, so when I got out of the shower, I was to step in a nice cold puddle of water. Also, we pay $100 a night for a hotel room and they don't offer wi-fi in the rooms? They DO offer it in the busy lobby, but then charge $15 an hour to use it? I don't mind paying for wi-fi, but at least let me get it in my room, not have to try to do business in the noisy and busy lobby. Nonsense. One more thing, the rooms are REALLY small and tight. The space between the end of my bed and the desk was about 1 foot. You barely have room to pull the chair back from the desk to sit down. It's more convenient to sit on the end of your bed to work on your desk. See the pics. They really stuffed the rooms into this place. I don't think it would have hurt them to give one or two more feet of room. The place has a nice little fitness center, but I can't tell you as my key card wouldn't unlock the door. For what I paid, you'd think that would be included. Did I have to go to the front desk again to get it added? Or get a separate card? I gave up. One other problem I had is trying to get a taxi. When you walk out, there is a black Lincoln Towncar, and they really push it on you. I guess everyone is getting a kickback from it. Every time I left, the security guard would ask me "Taxi?" and I'd say yes, and he'd hustle me over to the Towncar. I'd say, "No, I want a taxi", and the idiots would argue "This IS a taxi, sir!" and I'd say "No, that's a private car, a chauffered towncar. That's NOT a taxi." and so on, until I finally gave up and waved a cab down in the street. They come by often, so it wasn't a problem. The taxi was around 10-15 AED, the Towncar around 50 AED. Don't be tricked or conned into getting into that Towncar, it's a scam and the hotel should be ashamed of itself for trying to force the guests into it. I'm guessing the driver gives a kickback to someone. There's really no reason for it, there are plenty of clean, cheap taxis in the area. Also, when I asked at the front desk if they would call me a cab, they tried to get me to take the Towncar as well, and basically refused to call a cab when I refused to take the Towncar. Again, I just went out to the street and waved down a taxi. The front desk, the security guard, and the two guys in civilian clothes at the car, avoid talking to them about a taxi. Just get one yourself, as they won't help you. Also, the new Dubai Metro station "Emirates" is a short walk up the road from the hotel. I walked there several times and got a day pass, you have the entire Metro at your convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at a good price.”
Reviews.Author: stefrfc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel at the begining of April on a stop over between flights. Very handy for the airport as it's only a few minutes away. I usually stay at Dubai Le Meridien Airport Hotel but as it was only a short stop over I didn't want to waste the money on a room I was not going to use for a complete 24hrs. I was pleasantly surprised with the Holiday Inn Express as it was very modern and clean inside. The restaurant was nice inside and I had the buffet meal for dinner which is very cheap although there could have been a bit more of a choice for my liking but there is always the menu if you wish something different. No big deal for me. The bar is very nice with a good selection of drinks and the staff there I found to be very welcoming. The room was not as big as I am used to but hey, you get what you pay for and it was well worth the money. The bathroom was nice although the one thing I did notice was that the door stop on the back of the bathroom door was broken, again it did not hamper my stay and just a minor point. I requested an iron and ironing board and it was brought to my room in a timely manor also so no complaint there either. They have a bus service to the terminals that is well worth using as there are only independant taxis outside and they are expensive, about twice the price as normal taxis in Dubai. On the whole, maybe not 5* but it is clean, tidy, the food is ok, the beds are good and the staff are nice and it's also close to the airport. Can't complain about that and what else do you need for a short stay anyway. I'll probably use it again after my first stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed but the rest of the room is average”
Reviews.Author: Gevara
Reviews.Content: The bed is really really great and the quality of sleep is excellent. The rest of the room is okay i guess. The parking is not so good too as you park your car in a very dusty area. The hotel is not easy to get to and is far away from most of the attractions. The service in the hotel is okay

Reviews.Title: “Great location for over night stay at the airport.”
Reviews.Author: FEATHERSTONE74
Reviews.Content: Arrived Early hours of the morning into Dubai after flight from Newcastle England, we caught the free hotel shuttle bus from the airport T3 to the hotel which was a 5 minute transfer. The bus leaves 20 min to the hour each hour but not easy to find the pick up as not signposted so you had to look past the Taxi pick up and you'll find the bus stop. On arrival at the Hotel there was a long queue at check -in but as I'm a Priority Club Platinum Royal Ambassador member we went straight to the priority club Check - in as you do, Only two members of staff working on check in we were not acknowledged as members so after a long wait we went and waited even longer in the normal queue. We got to to our room after 3am with No sorry about the wait and was put into a TWIN room but we had BOOKED a DOUBLE. THATS the down side of the hotel Great room very nice new hotel Great free breakfast but served between 06.30 till 09.30. Yes we would stay here again and will recommend to others, BUT they just do not recognise Priority Club members!!!!! Also if you are taking a taxi to elsewhere in Dubai or back to the airport be advised that the starting fare is 20 Dirham plus the fare when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: medutra
Reviews.Content: Me & my husband stayed in Holiday Inn Express for a couple of nights on our way back to Canada. To be honest I was blown away by how efficient their staff was and attentative, from helping us at the reception, when we first arrived to the hotel, to arranging our cab for us for the following day going to the airport. In addition to the great convenience of the hotel's closeness to the airport the affordability of their prices tops it all. I would surely come back to the Holiday Inn Express hotel Dubai airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Experience at HYExpress Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Vape72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for having the chance to visit Dubai as flying with Emirates my final destination was Mauritius. I booked it through the IHG website and at time of reservation i also sent an email to make double sure the bay bed was properly arranged. The arrival day, it was really late, I asked once again at the reception desk if the baby bed was provided as my family and me and above all our kid (16 months old) was really tired. When I got into the room I realized no baby bed was arranged and there was no way to talk to the reception using the internal hotel telephone. I went down to the desk and after queuing a long time for talking to an available receptionist, I am an IHG gold member and no one was at the Gold Member hospitality desk, I asked for providing the baby bed. After 15 mins or more a room porter came up to my room and started unpack aging up. After another 20 mins looking at any way to open it, he realized the baby bed was broken and there was no another one available. I was asked to make my kid sleeping into the sofa bad, which was unsafe and not comfortable. I decided to talk to the receptionist who did not apology for the inconvenience at all and in rude manner kept doing his job. The hotel in general is not bad unless for the unpleasant smell into the room due to humidity coming from the bathroom, very small. The shuttle bus is working fine indeed.

Reviews.Title: “good and convenient value”
Reviews.Author: jef-ind
Reviews.Content: I had a long layover in Dubai (12+ hours) and took a room here. It is right near the airport and about 10 minutes' walk from the Dubai Metro "Emirates" station. The hotel was clean, service was friendly, and the room well appointed. It was also good to be near public transit, although a taxi to the center of Dubai only cost about 25 dirhams. The only drawback was the shuttle, which only runs once an hour. So you might have to wait a while for it...

Reviews.Title: “It's ok for a night”
Reviews.Author: Cobeat
Reviews.Content: If you take the shuttle bus you might have to wait a while before ther is one. If you take a Taxi they charge about 8-10 Dhm but from the Aiport they start from 20 ! So you'll end up payning around 30 Dhm in the end. You can only pay cash aswell. The hotel is relstively new and clean. When I arrived my room wasn't free so I had to go into a Twin-smokers room..I only wanted to sleep so I was ok with it. In the afternoon I got my single-non smokers room. The breakfast is nothing special so if you like some egg in the morning you'll be disappointed. Ther is toast, yoghurt, cheese and marmalade. And appels and bananas ..but that was basically it. Although you don't here any noise from the airport.. you still hear everything going on in you hallway. I had a Indian bus group in my hall and in the rooms next to me. So I heard them talking all the time..and knocking on my door cause they thought my room was part of their group too. So the first nights were very noisy. It's ok if you only stay theyre to stop for a night but I wouldn't stay there any longer (btw. it's in the middle of nowhere ) .

Reviews.Title: “Great valu for money”
Reviews.Author: made_in_ukraine
Reviews.Content: Great location for a transit in Dubai Airport. There is a free shuttle bus to/from the airport, but it does not run very often (as a matter of fact, I think it goes once per hour). The room was clean, and met the usual standards of HIE hotels. On a negative note, the hotel has a bit of a smoke smell, coming from the bar... This was not a major issue for me, but I can see it being somewhat bothering for our guests. Overall, if the price is right, the hotel is a great place for a few hours of rest/showe/sleep.

Reviews.Title: “I thought emirates was 5 star not 2!”
Reviews.Author: timbo987
Reviews.Content: Normally stay in the many 4 or 5 star hotels in Dubai esp at the jumiera end. This time I was going to Sydney and was put up courtesy of emirates. Couldnt complain as it was free and my mate would call me a snob! After an 8 hour flight from Lhr we queued for 45 mins for a bus then 30 mins at reception. Finally I got to my room only to find a lady asleep! Both of us were horrified so I headed down to reception for another 30 mins and didn't even get an apology! At this point I realised I had given up and didnt want to cause a scene so I headed up again. Luckily no one in the room and it was fine for me. Actually the bed was pretty comfy. Then I could hear constant suit cases being dragged to and from the lift! Not a good sleep. All in all wish I had stayed at the airport or paid for a 4 star!

Reviews.Title: “practical”
Reviews.Author: crawfie
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a night on the way in and out of Dubai, and this is a holiday inn express, and what you see is what you get! The rooms are clean and comfortable (although noise from adjacent rooms is annoying). Inclusive breakfast has a good choice. The shuttle to terminals 1 and 2 only runs hourly, and if missed, there is a starting fare of 20 UAE from the aitrport, where queues can be long. Going the other way, the reception tried to push an upmarket resident taxi (very expensive) on me, but if pushed, they will phone a local taxi who charge around 15 UAE to get to the airport. I find it frustrating that in a developed country where the Terminal is in full view from the hotel, it is not possible to walk there without a 4 km. detour! Local taxis to the Creek etc. are also quite reasonable. A drink in the bar in the evening is however a wallet emptying experience. Staff are friendly. As somewhere to get some shuteye, it fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: GingerHongKong
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a layover in Dubai. It's opposite the airport terminal but you still need to take a taxi there (about 5 or 7 dirhams). The service is limited but the rooms are new and clean. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are v quiet (didn't hear any airplane noise... but that cld have been b/c it was late at night). Bathrooms are also clean and new - only shampoo is provided so you need your own toiletries. Breakfast is included - spartan selection but ok for a free quick bite. Overall, v happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good to have a sleep, but very mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Thefall
Reviews.Content: + the price reflects the quality. I paid 100$ for 2 nights transit stay, so it was fine in comparison with higher class hotels like Le Meridien or Hyatt. + rooms average, but satisfy all needs of a transit traveller - shower and bed. - shuttle service on arrival is a joke. They requested me to provide flight details - don't know why because shuttle runs on its own schedule, once in an hour. No signs at the arrival hall, no information, thanks to the concierge of Millenium hotel who helped me. Finally I took a taxi because the hotel seemed to be quite near. Then I found out that it just SEEMED quite close, because there's no direct access - so it took 15 minutes and 7 USD to get there. - staff is slow, sleepy and not very well english-speaking. No wake-up calls, so take care of yourself to not miss your flight.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: afinanika
Reviews.Content: Not best one. rooms are tiny and has no free internet which other cheaper hotels can afford it, no wake up calls and, is close to airport which is good if you need so. no pick up from terminal 2 but they arranged a drop-off to terminal 2.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned! No airport shuttle from Terminal 2.”
Reviews.Author: Max S
Reviews.Content: Standard Holiday Inn express, ok, no frills, hell they will not even do a wakeup call. 35 Dirham for 2 hours of net access. Next door Premier Inn is better deal unless your collecting priority club pionts.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep at the airport.”
Reviews.Author: ronandkristin
Reviews.Content: The previous reviewer couldn't have got it more right as far as I am concerned. This hotel is fine for a quick stop off at the airport. If I had been staying longer I think I would be complaining about the miserable reception staff I had to deal with, but it was no big deal as it was a flying visit. The room was well thought out and had a great shower. I also thought the bed was incredibly comfortable. The hotel was very quiet and a good nights sleep is no problem here. I found the shuttle to be a waste of time coming from the airport, so I took a cab. It cost me 35 aed. (about 6GBP) and only took a few minutes. We never ate here so can't comment on food. All in all this is a good example of Holiday Inn Express. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hanimex99
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my elderly mother, and had a 22 hours transit in Dubia. Made my book 2 months before traveling, thus got a very good price. However, its a good idea to shop around the various website. Having emailed the hotel (reservation.airport@hiexdubai.ae) regarding the free airport shuttle, I was sent a timetable. The service leaves just outside Terminal 3 Arrivals, every hour at 40 minutes. There was no problems here, it was on time, just had to wait 10-15 minutes. (Which was helpful, as both my mother and I have difficulty walking long distances.) The checkin process was fast enongh. Rooms were clean and to a good standard. Towels and soaps are provided, also coffee/tea make facilities. Breakfast was okish, I'd say 7/10...........I have had better and have had worst. Cereals, fresh fruits, yogurts, toast, pastries, juices, coffee, tea were all avalible in the buffet, but no hot foods such as eggs, bake beans etc. However, when you're on a budget, the option of breakfast included in the price is plus. Hotel is not based near anything, but if your planning to take a taxi everywhere its ok. If you need a night or 2 stay and want to be near the airport.........then yes, go for this one. The Airport shuttle from the hotel leaves every hour, on the hour, back to the Airport. Its free and very convenient, but be aware, I've heard there can be a queue for this 12 seater shuttle. If you have a few hours before your flight, you can catch the metro from the airport, and go and explore the city. Hope this helps, have a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: MarkHamburg
Reviews.Content: located very close to DXB airport but be aware that there's no pedestrian bridge over the expressway between airport and hotel. From my room, I could see the apron of Terminal 3 and the Emirates jets taxiing about. I could not hear a sound though and the curtains close out the light very well too. So location is good if you just need a bed between two flights. If you want to do sightseeing on foot or just walk around a little this is not the place as there is nothing in the neighborhood. I took a rental car so it didn't matter to me. The rooms are pretty much international chain standard in size and amenities, cleaning of the bathroom could have been better - there was some lotion (or worse) on the vertical part of the sink. Rest of the bathroom and the room itself were clean. There is a bar in the hotel where you can buy drinks (also alcoholic beverages) but the fridge in the room is empty (I didn't expect beer or the like but a bottle of water or some sodas wouldn't hurt - rather inconvenient to walk to the bar for a bottle of water). There is free parking for guests in the underground garage. A bit disappointing: breakfast: a) it starts at 6 am only - strange for a hotel that must be getting 95% of its customers from the 24/7 airport next door b) choice was quite limited: no eggs, no cold cuts, nothing hot like grilled tomatoes / potatoes, no beef or turkey sausages. I didn't see any information that they would start limited service with a "continental" breakfast and go for full breakfast later so I have to assume that's all there is... I'm not a real breakfast person but jetlag can make you very hungry at an unusual hour so I took issue with this. To be fair: you definitely won't starve as there is jam, cheese, joghurt, fruit, muesli but it's still definitely substandard. Note: if you think it doesn't matter as you are probably entitled to a free breakfast at the airport courtesy of Emirates: prepare to queue for half an hour to get in that restaurant in the first place. Apart from the unimpressive breakfast a very good experience and I'm likely to come again when I have a long connection at DXB again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service with delicious food”
Reviews.Author: sirri
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Holiday Inn, primarily because of the staff. From the moment we arrived, they appeared to show a genuine interest in ensuring that we enjoyed our time in dubai, and they were always able to suggest activities/venues in response to our queries. We never walked to the lift without a smile from at least one of the staff in restaurant. The food was really delicious and I never had food like in any hotel, in middle east. I had my dinner with my wife and the waiter & supervisor (ranjan & mehboob) he remembered me & my selection of what we had last time & i met with chef (abdul nayeem) personally, who prepared the food & he arranged the buffet in sophestic manner with mehboob and ranjan. All in all we were very happy with this hotel . Can't speak to negative comments (some people are never happy) but we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great food!”
Reviews.Author: Amdya
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights and I got the best 2 nights sleep while I was In Dubai. The hotel is near the airport terminal 3. Surprisingly the rooms have good sound proofing and it is very quiet in spite of being right across to the airport and meters away from the metro station.
