The rooms are spacious enough for a business or a solo traveler and bed comfortable. The hotel has a big restaurant and also has a bar. The restaurant also has a breakfast buffet and a lunch/ dinner buffet depending on the occupancy. The menu is not fussy and the quality of service/food is good as well. The bar is pretty big(smoking allowed in the bar) and serves a variety of drinks. They also serve food. Overall I would say the place is great value for money. What else to expect, it fits the budget, conveniently accessible to the city, good food and a great nights sleep. All this without a hole in your wallet!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Rani78
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best budget hotels in Dubai which enjoys an excellent location for the traveller being less than 5 minutes from Dubai International Airport. Rooms are modern,clean with the most comfortable beds which ive seen in life ! Howwever breakfast selecion is a bit disspointing with no hot items and no eggs...you will need to manage with cold items,cereals and juice. Staff are very friendly,welcoming and very attentive to all requests. I would like to thank Yaser for the high levels of customer service....I shall be returning soon

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy your holiday at this inn”
Reviews.Author: Mhomamdh
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at several hotels in Dubai, and this turned out to be a good choice. Easy to find and get to. Located in a safe neighborhood, close to the airport.The room was a decent size. It could have used a bit more counter room in the bathroom, but overall adequate. The closet/TV/drawer combination is interesting - the only negative was the closet was dark, and the light above it wasn't quite positioned correctly so you could see inside. Beds were excellent. Carpet in the hallway did have a big stain on it on our floor but otherwise the place was well kept. and Breakfast is one of the biggest conveniences in staying at this hotel. You'll find many hotels don't necessarily have a place to eat and you'll have to find a updated news every morning. The breakfast area was apparently not part of the original design. We were glad we looked it over the night before. You'll see the one side with all of the food along one wall that juts in and out, and tables across. Then if you take note - there is another room on the side of the elevators that appears larger - which has a coffee station and tables. This was our preferred location to eat breakfast - less crowded. The food was good, hot and well replenished. The two coffee stations made a big difference getting breakfast out quickly. The hot Danish are always the best part. a part of that the staff of the hotel are really friendly. we never feel that we are away from home specially Ariel, Anthony, priyaranjan, Tenzing. Overall we'd recomend this hotel as a good place to stay in Dubai and we would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good to be nearby .. Services need extra attention”
Reviews.Author: Ghazi67
Reviews.Content: I checked in around 05:00 AM coming from Kuala Lumpur . Its my 1st time to check in this hotel. I Have I have chosen it due to its nearby location. Took advantage of my Priority Club to get a late checkout ( although checked out early ). Hotel is fairly clean, yet there was a smell of wet rugs all around.!!!!! Smell is noticiable when in room. The breakfast was a total surprise fro me. It was limited to corn flackes, yougurt,fruits and two types of breat ( Arabic & Sliced ) in addition to plain Croissant. U gotta pay to get eggs !! The managment should really work more on Room Service. I had to wait for almost 40 min for an iron board !!! and a request for a weakup call was turned down by front desk, asking me to use the snoozer ( which didn't work ) !!!!! I recommend this hotel for no more than a night, for transit travellers who want to streach out and have a good shower.

Reviews.Title: “Right next to the airport - a good stop-over hotel”
Reviews.Author: calvin0307
Reviews.Content: No faults on location if a good transit hotel is required. Adequate breakfast spread. Very nice lobby. Kudos to Sylvia from the front desk - professional and prompt. Checking in was effortless. Rooms nice and clean. Quiet. And the 7am free shuttle to the terminals is a good touch. Wireless from room will be a good addition to the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Express....”
Reviews.Author: Travelguy365
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Dubai based on recommendations from colleagues from work. The price, $70, was good for the way over-priced Dubai. The hotel was extremely clean since being about 8 months old. Nice lobby with bar. Restaurant had a reasonable (for Dubai prices) dinner buffet for $14 (50 dirhams) with a good assortment of grilled chicken, pastas, desserts ect. This price for Dubai is a great value. The decor of the restaurant was very modern and chic. Breakfast was a bit disappointing being only cold items, no eggs included. Very nice modern, well equiped gym on the top floor overlooking the airports runway. The room was nice and appropriate for a few nights. The bed was very comfortable and had a choice of soft and medium pillows. Internet was $23 (85 dirhams) for one day. No such luck of free internet in Dubai. I have stayed at $200 a night hotels their and it is the same. I guess they believe a business person that stays at a 3 to 5 star hotel has no need for the internet or does not mind spending $20-30 more a night for it. Overall a good deal at $70 for a evening. Dinner was great and room, and bed, made the night a worthwhile stay...even if it was an express!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: fuzzy0duck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Dubai Airport two nights ago when I was on a 24-hour layover in Dubai. Initially, I was a bit apprehensive as I had read a lot of the reviews here about the supposedly unreliable airport shuttle, so I emailed the hotel beforehand to inform them of my times and they replied with a schedule of their buses. The buses pick passengers up from the Arrivals Area (not Departures, as some other reviewers experienced) outside Exit 2. The buses depart every 40 minutes past the hour every 24 hours (1.40, 2.40, 3.40 and so on) and when I was there it was on-time. Encountered no problems with the airport shuttle at all. The hotel itself is a 5 minute drive away. As I had arrived at their doorstep at 8 in the morning, there was no room ready. However the receptionist told me there would be one ready in an hour. In the meantime, I requested to have the next day's complimentary breakfast at that time, as my flight out the next day was before breakfast began (6am). They were very obliging. The breakfast spread was quite simple but good enough - cereal, toast, bread, croissants, labaneh yogurt, tomatoes, olives and cucumber, yogurt, milk and juices. As promised, the room was ready in an hour. It is not big but more than enough for a short stay. The room and bathroom were spotless - I have absolutely no complaints. A shampoo/body wash was provided in a dispenser; if you are more comfortable using toiletries you are more familiar with I suggest you bring your own. There is no free internet in this hotel; the rates are actually quite ridiculous! However, there is a computer at the Priority counter at the reception that can be used for short access to anything important. I'm not sure if it is only for the Priority Club members, though, but I saw many people use it and the receptionists didn't seem to mind. I took a taxi from the hotel to Dubai Mall - it cost 50 Dhs. The hotel also provides a shuttle to Festival City and the Emirates Metro - enquire at the reception for more information. I got back to the hotel by taking a Metro to the airport, and met the airport shuttle there to take me back. Airport shuttles from the hotel to the airport depart on the hour, every hour, 24 hours. The staff at this hotel were very friendly and helpful. I thought that this stay was good value (I paid almost 80 Euros for a night - it's a bargain by Dubai standards) and it is definitely more than enough for a short stay. In short, it was almost perfect and I have no complaints whatsoever about my stay and would return again if I have to!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you are just passing through”
Reviews.Author: SeresM
Reviews.Content: What a contrast to the Holiday Inn on the Sheikh Zayed Road. This one has a good gym, but the rooms do indeed smell of damp, there are insalubrious people about, the building looks like a prison (maybe the identical looking Premier Inn next door is better?) the food and drink is overpriced (the breakfast is appalling, the buffet dinner is virtually inedible), the staff are fairly uncooperative on the whole, and there is no pool, of course. The internet is expensive, too. Stay there only if you are passing through. Holiday Inn - this hotel is not good for your brand image.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & co-operative staff”
Reviews.Author: reed90
Reviews.Content: I stayed 8 days with my wife & brother-in-law this hotel. This hotel is very new and clean & sophisticated. The food of the restaurant is good & reasonable & also the staff are very helpful & good sales man (especially ranjan & grace in restaurant ) because we arrived from our work & we ordered some snacks but he suggested buffet lunch and that was really great. So overall experience was great & checked out today.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing! Definitely not 4star. More like a brand new 2star motel.”
Reviews.Author: icyoubaby
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very disappointing. -Check-in at 2am when the hotel was very quiet took a long time due to a very drunk couple trying to book a room. No effort was made to speed the process up. Meanwhile, another drunk person in the line behind me obviously decided he couldn't wait any longer to pay for his bottle of water so he just ran off to the elevator despite the shouts of the check-in agent. All very disconcerting. -Stepping out of the elevator to the room there was a cigarette butt lying on the carpet. -Two laundry trolleys were just abandoned in the hotel corridor, one turned over. -One of my pillows was covered in mascara and make-up and the towel in the bathroom was dirty. -Breakfast is merely toast, fruit and yoghurt. All of the above makes me very surprised that this hotel, although seemingly quite new, could ever be considered close to 4stars. The standard was shockingly poor. Advice would be to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Quite close to the airport, good place for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Crabou
Reviews.Content: Emirates airline sent me one night in this hotel due to flight disruption : it is 1km away from the airport and there is a free shuttle running every hour that takes drives you in 5 minutes. However be careful that it is impossible to go to the airport by foot because there is a major highway to cross. Hotel is fine and clean, rooms are small but confortable and quiet. Buffet dinner is quite good but beware that restaurant room is crowded and very noisy. Apart from that staff is friendly and this hotel is good choice for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Transit Hotel - Great Food”
Reviews.Author: ShyFlyer
Reviews.Content: We were tuck in Dubai for two days on standby before we got on a flight. The hotel is brand new, and is very modern and clean. The hotel restaurant has serves great food for all meals. Breakfast is free, and lunch is AED30 for a three course set menu. Dinner is AED50 for a buffet. All food was good standard. The hotel does offer a free shuttle leaving every hour to Terminals 1 & 3. Call the hotel to check times, as staff at the airport do not have any info and told us to take a taxi. McDonalds, Subway etc is about 10 minute walk away, but don't bother! The hotel restaurant is so good, and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect transit hotel for those longer stays....”
Reviews.Author: andrewt333
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what my wife and I needed - cheap, simple, and clean. It was a place to sleep a few hours and take a much needed shower. Comfort - Much of what you can find at most Holiday Inn Express's. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are a fair size. Shuttle Service - FREE for those staying at the hotel. Runs frequently and we had no problems at all getting to or from the airport. Very efficient and only takes about 10 minutes or so each way. Price - very reasonable and can find good rates on places like Expedia. I would certainly recommend this hotel for anyone who has a transit in Dubai and needs to get out of the airport. The staff are also very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: mystery2010
Reviews.Content: Like other travellers, I had to wait ages for the shuttle service and the sign posting for the shuttle is also very vague. The hotel room was quiet nice except there was no bottled water to drink and no bathing soap. I also liked the fact the there was a choice hard or soft pillows. It would be nice if there was shuttle service from the hotel to the town centre. The staff were quite helpful and the service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “shuttle bus airport to hotel below par”
Reviews.Author: sagittarius111
Reviews.Content: nothing wrong with the hotel, but the frequency of the shuttle bus between airport and hotel is too low, forcing you to wait outside by 40 degC for half an hour... besides, the shuttle bus was broke and they replace it by a minivan where maximum 4 persons could fit in!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD IN-TRANSIT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MsRM
Reviews.Content: we were in this hotel in transit flying with emirates so we did not book it. upon arrival we had to wait nearly an hour for the shuttle bus for the hotel. even then it was hard to tell it was the hotel bus as the name of the hotel was not written in english. they have no luggage transporter for the shuttle bus so all luggage has to be put in the bus with you. ther service was efficient despite the long wait in the heat (there are no seats to wait on outsied either). hotel check in was froendly and efficient. they do not offer wake up call service for flights but they do have alarm clock in each room. the roomand decor is is modern and clean. witha choice of pilloe firmness (impressive). the bathrrom is clean and modern and the towels are nice and large. the room was quiet and we slept well. the breakfast was adequate but not a lot of variety. we waited for the daytime shuttle which was not actually the bus. they only operate a "people-mover" (holds 5-6 people) during the day back and forth. our 7am queue was long (15 people)and soon when they relaied how long it would take to be collected they all arranged their own taxis, leaving us next in line for the shuttle. which was good. so be prepared to wait an hour earlier for the shuttle than expected if it is busy. overall the hotel is nice and new and i would recomend it for people in transit , but not for holiday as you can probably find a hotel near the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, efficient service and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: jade41
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the hotel for one night, i came through terminal 3 and i have used the free shuttle bus, i had to wait 10 minutes at the arrival area of terminal 3, however the driver was very friendly and helpful. the hotel is new, staff are very friendly, the hotel is very clean, nice spacious lobby with wireless internet. the room was quiet small however well equipped. breakfast was inclusive with the room rate and it was quiet right for me. it's a fantastic value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brown water and mildew”
Reviews.Author: malakialj
Reviews.Content: After having flown through the night, the only thing I wanted to do was brush my teeth, shower and sleep. The water that came out of the bathroom faucet was brown. The tile in shower had mildew all over it which would not have been hard for the hotel staff to clean. The bed though, was comfortable. The front desk staff was extremely rude on each of the three occasions I had interactions with them and each time I spoke with a different person. They also refused to place a wake-up call for me. Also, there is no printer in the Business Center, so you can not print up your boarding passes. I was told I could put my boarding pass on a jump drive and the front desk would print it. How many people travel with a jump drive? My visit to Dubai was during Ramadan, which I know nothing about. It would have been helpful if the hotel had prepared a notice about Ramadan, letting me know the "do's and don'ts", especially about the eating and drinking, and about the holiday itself.

Reviews.Title: “convenient, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: jovani_10
Reviews.Content: I had to wait for more than an hour for the shuffle The hotel is far from any shops or restaurants, some staff are nice & helpful others are not. very little choice for a very expensive breakfast in fact don't bother with breakfast. the rooms are very clean, the mattress,bed cover and pillows are cheap, very nice and clean showers and toilet. you also need to pay for internet services , very expencive and very slow plus you can't make call through Skype as it illegal in UAE. over all its practical if you need a hotel near Dubai airport for one night but do not go there for a holiday !!

Reviews.Title: “Best 2* Hotel in the World!”
Reviews.Author: LC888
Reviews.Content: Wow, what can I say. I was a little worried about the 2* factor since I always go for nothing but the best out there. However, I needed to stay close to the airport as my family was transiting in Dubai for a few hours and I wanted them to have somewhere to rest before their next flight. In addition, they were arriving early in the morning and I didn't want to have to travel from Abu Dhabi so early in the morning. Hence, I stayed one night at this airport. I read reviews from another website that it is very difficult to find but I was glad that the location map emailed to me by the hotel meant that I didn't even get lost trying to get to it (I normally get lost driving around Dubai!) They ample parking at the basement but the only thing is the exit ramp lane is very narrow and one has to be careful if you have a big car like mine. It was very tight at the turning to exit the carpark as there is a column at the turn. The room even offered "soft" and "firm" pillows option which I was really impressed with. It is also very quiet, so, one can get a good rest. I don't have much issues with the hourly shuttle although I've heard many complaints from others on this. It would have been great if they also have hourly shuttle to the nearest shopping mall such as Dubai Festival City. As I hate driving in Dubai, I wasn't going to drive to find the next shopping mall! The only rather amusing thing was the Cisco telephone has a private welcome message except I'm not the person they welcomed! All in all, I enjoyed the hotel and reckons it's possibly the best value hotel in Dubai right now.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money but watch out for shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Timbolo
Reviews.Content: They really must sort out the shuttle from the airport to the hotel. It's really vague as to where one should wait for the shuttle; even when we were in the right area (departure exit 3) it wasn't obvious - poor signage doesn't help either. We gave up and took a taxi at high speed as is the norm in Dubai. The hotel only used a small people-carrier when we were there, just enough for about 4 passengers and their luggage. We did take the shuttle from the hotel to the metro (to visit Dubai Mall) at Terminal 3 which was quite handy, but you really have to be "on the ball" if you want to get the shuttle back to the hotel as the driver only waited for a very short time before he was off again into the hazy distance. The hotel itself was OK, more or less what we expected for the price (about 240 Dirham). We were allocated an accessible room on the ground floor, therefore no shower screen just a huge expanse of tiled floor which meant that water went everywhere! Breakfast was satisfactory without being memorable and could have done with a little more variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for metro and airport.”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-traveler-04
Reviews.Content: The main point of staying here was that we had an overnight stay and just needed somewhere to sleep as we would be busy sightseeing. Whilst it is right next to the airport, we slept soundly even though we faced the runway, as you cant notice the aircraft taking off. The staff were helpful and polite and the breakfast was the usual Holiday Inn fare. You currently need to take a taxi from the airport to the hotel, even though you can see it from terminal 2 which costs $6 australian. They are going to build a walkway in the future though.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: seshnath
Reviews.Content: New Construction. Good location. Courteous staff and good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “OK Once you get there.”
Reviews.Author: MCMVegas
Reviews.Content: Pay attention to the fact that the shuttle does not come to the Arrival area downstairs (which would be the logical place) rather it comes to the Departure area, which is upstairs. Be prepared to explain to the airport security that you truly want to be in the Departure area (they may call the hotel to confirm this fact). Aside from being a minor pain once you see the arrival area you will understand why. Once at the hotel it is ok, clean, air conditioning works well. The breakfast is pathetic by American standards (the one at the Holiday Inn Express - Internet City is acceptable). No pool or exercise area. For a basic hotel close to the airport, it is acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “New Facility, Little Service”
Reviews.Author: Travelhui
Reviews.Content: The hotel facility is new a comfortable, but there is nearly no service. Importantly, if you need a pickup from the airport, you must pre-book. Going from the hotel to the airport, there is a shuttle that runs only once an hour. There is also no help with luggage. It is fairly good value, however, if you are simply looking for a plain overnight transit stay, so long as you pre-book your pickup and travel relatively light.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: sm105
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a step up from the Holiday Inn Express properties one might be used to in Europe and North America as it features a full service restaurant and bar. The property is spotless and the staff go out of their way to be helpful and friendly. The only catch is that it is not particularly convenient to access even though it is visible both from the airport terminal and the Emirates metro station. However, for a short overnight in Dubai this definitely is a super value option to braving the traffic into town.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to get to hotel”
Reviews.Author: shanksct
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel said that they will send the complimentary shuttle, it did not show up. I had to rent a car and had an extremely difficult time getting to the hotel even though I could see the hotel from Terminal 3

Reviews.Title: “Right across Terminal 3 of Dubai Airport”
Reviews.Author: ALLIGATOR9
Reviews.Content: I had to spend a few hours in Dubai for a business meeting on my way to New York...having just over 14hrs between flights, Holiday Inn express across the airport seemed perfect. Comfortable rooms with a bar and a shuttle service to & fro to the airport made it very convenient. I stayed there on my way back also for another meeting for a few hours and being economical it made sense to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: advtracing
Reviews.Content: well good and bad , the good ... nice hotel , friendly staff , good rooms etc.... the bad ... well you can't walk anywhere , so you have to get a taxi to anything inc food . the shuttle was no were to be found when i arrived even though i had sorted it to be there. so a taxi for 3 min from the airport to the hotel was 35aed!!! don't trust google maps also , distances are out. on a side line , what is wrong with the airport staff at dubai!!! they treat you like your crap and how dare you ask a question?????????

Reviews.Title: “not much better then the last time”
Reviews.Author: zoerobinson
Reviews.Content: So I missed my flight back to the UK and got sent here. I wasn't paying so couldn't complain. I stayed here before and found that this time the service hadn't improved much since I stayed at the start of the year when it was new. There was nothing wrong it was just really robotic and I might as well have checked in with a machine! Same at the breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “So impressed! Not the Holiday Inn of our childhood.”
Reviews.Author: philsdottir
Reviews.Content: I stayed here only one night, really only about 7 or 8 hours, because I was booked here when my flight out of Dubai was delayed overnight until late the next morning. By the time I got there it was well after 10 pm, and I had to check out to catch the 6 am shuttle to the airport. So there you have it. And ordinarily I wouldn't even be writing a review of the Holiday Inn Express, let alone being in it for so short a time. But I was impressed. It is NOT the same establishment as in the U.S. Maybe because it's Dubai. Or maybe it's that they are revamping and all the new ones are like this. Either way I was impressed. This is meant to be a bare-bones hotel, so I wouldn't expect the same amenities as at the Emirates Palace. But still, check-in was efficient and friendly. (The one negative was that the airline told us the hotel van would be picking us up from the sidewalk, and I only saw one hotel van - and it didn't stop. But I don't know that this was the hotel's fault or that of the airline which was pretty disorganized as it was and maybe didn't tell the hotel... we ended up taking a taxi and the hotel paid the fare.) This hotel is really, really pretty, with sage green and lavender textiles, and while small, the bathrooms, including shower stalls, were laid out really nicely. Everything so crisp and clean! I very much appreciated the clock radio which had an alarm, and the safe, which was wonderful to have. Because I was socializing, I only got an hour of sleep, and I remember laying down and thinking I would just rest, because who falls asleep in an hour when they know they've got to be up to catch a flight - but the bed was really comfortable, the linens crisp and with a choice of hard and soft pillows (I chose the hard), I just fell right asleep! My room didn't have a view, but hey, it's a hotel room, who cares. The hotel has a bar (hence the socializing), which is nice, and they even gave me a drink gratis at one point. At one point there had to have been at least 25 of us stranded travelers at the bar and they did a great job handling the demand (and distributing free popcorn). Elevators were plentiful and efficient. There is a gratis breakfast in the morning but it opens at 6 - and there's an hourly free shuttle to the airport as well, but it leaves on the hour beginning at 6, and I needed to be on it, so I didn't get to try the breakfast. Check-out and going to the airport were easy and efficient as well. Again, really, really impressed. This is not the Holiday Inn of family vacations in decades past.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new, and very nice”
Reviews.Author: pp1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on two occeasions, on our way to Switzerland, and on the way back. On the first occasion, we had a stamndard room, which although small, was brand new, spotlessly clean, very quiet, and all you could ask for in a quick stopover. On the way back, we were upgraded at no charge to a huge room, that was fantastic. It's just over the road from Emirates Terminal 3, but you have to get a taxi $9 AUD for a fare at midnight, or catch the free shuttle. It runs on demand on the hour, so you have to call and book it. We had one of the free continental breakfasts, which was great. You could easily stay here, and do all the things you wanted to in Dubai. Staff very friendly and helpful. Make sure you have a credit card, as they demend a credit card ( not debit card) imprint. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: hoclinda
Reviews.Content: Good hotel ,stayed here on our way to Brisbane.Good value would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A brandnew and nice Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: pore
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the airport very early in the morning, we realized that there is no way to walk the 700 meters to the hotel and we did not find a shuttle (signalisation at the airport was not clear to us). Finally we took a taxi and made first a roundtrip around Dubai. The Hotel staff was very friendly. It took them more time for check-in then in other hotels. We thought it is because of a lack of routine. The rooms are small (which is OK in accordance with the price of this hotel) but very clean and well furnished. Also the restaurant, where you can not only have breakfast like in the old Holiday Inn Express hotels was nice and we liked all the the staff. They helped when ever needed and were very friendly. From the hotel we took the shuttle to the airport (order at the reception desk) and from there the metro to dwontown Dubai. We can warmly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “friendly service staff”
Reviews.Author: regee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very new & its very near to airport, i stayed 3 days in this hotel and embiance of room , bar & restaurant is great. The staff of restaurant is very friendly,especially mr sandeep, priyajan & varun. i will alway suggest this hotel, for staying

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff & Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Kelvin_Seow
Reviews.Content: Firstly, please do not attempt to walk from Dubai Airport Terminal 3 to the hotel like me. It is impossible with the massive road network in between. You either take the Metro to Emirates station and walk 7 mins to the hotel down the street or wait for their shuttle bus outside the departure terminal (Exit 2). The only problem is you don't know what the bus is going to be there. Secondly, I was very impressed with the service at the reception. Fast and no hassle. The restaurant staff was very friendly and greet you by name. The restaurant had a group party hence very noisy. I wanted to takeaway my food to the room but the restaurant doesn't do that. I had my dinner and left quickly. Thirdly, my room cardkeys seem to have problem all the time. I had to re-validate my cardkeys 3 times in 2 nights stay. This was the only time which really bugged me. The reception staff suggested that I placed my cardkeys too near to my mobile phone hence the problem. I stay in hotel with cardkeys at least 100 nights per year. So, I don't not need to be told like that. Finally, I check out at 0545 hrs and was at Terminal 3 by 0610 hrs. Fast and easy process. Yes, I would stay in this hotel but will carry a separate bag to keep the cardkeys.

Reviews.Title: “Good location across from the airport”
Reviews.Author: Neezy9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a layover between flights. It's just across from terminal 3. You can actually see it from the terminal. Didn't bother with the shuttle bus as they only run on the hour. It's only a short taxi journey which cost AED 37.00! On the way back to the airport AED 12.00. The new metro station is a 10 min walk down the road. It's a good clean hotel with comfortable beds and a nice continental breakfast in the morning, helpful staff. The staff in general was helpful, but there is room for improvement on their English especially at the reception. I would use this hotel again for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient hotel with friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: AlexG19
Reviews.Content: I had recently visited Dubai for 2 days and chose this hotel as it's new and the rate was very competitive and breakfast inclusive, it's quiet better then some of the 4 and 5 stars hotel i know...staff was extremely friendly and helpful, the hotel is clean and has a good look to it with no comparison to the same brand in europe! as expected it was continental breakfast which was fine and we had the chance to eat once dinner which was really tasty, i will defenitely come back again as it's a great value for money...

Reviews.Title: “sterile service and hotel”
Reviews.Author: zoerobinson
Reviews.Content: Whilst there was nothing wrong with the hotel I found the whole stay and the service a bit enforced. The check in was slow and lacked basic information, the room although new lacked any enthusiasm. The bar was sterile and lacked atmosphere and there was sewage tanks out the front during the day (not sure what for as my friends that live in Dubai have drains!). I thought I'd try this hotel as the hotel I stayed at previously "Premier" next door was full but next time I'll book back in there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service under exceptional circumstances”
Reviews.Author: DP1Hampshire
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel after getting stuck on route from Bankok to London due to the Icelandic volcano crisis. This is a typical airport hotel but with exceptional staff. Several plane loads of us arrived all at once at very short notice, unable to fly to our destination. The hotel did its best for all of us under very difficult circumstances. All the staff were frindly and very helpful and the manager did everything he could to keep us informed about the unfolding flight situation by liaising with the airline. This was well over and above his role. The restaurant staff ( and probably others) were working 18 hours a day to ensure that everyone could be accommodated and other staff were helping out as well. I was very impressed by the professional approach of all staff and their willingness to go the extra mile to make us feel welcome and reassured. They helped to make a difficult situation manageable and it was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: rerems
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for a night before flying out of Dubai. This was convenient to the airport. The hotel is new, clean and has a great and helpful staff. The rooms are typical of a business type hotel but we had a king bed with choice of pillows and a comforter on the bed. Slept great after getting in on a late flight the night before. Adequate breakfast included. Convenient taxi ride into city sights. They let us check out late at 2:00 PM.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Dubai Airport
HotelInfo.Address: opposite Dubai Airport Terminal 3 | P.O. Box 35257, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
